intro: Humboltia malachantha, commonly known as the Malachantha, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Humboltia malachantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
